item.description:
Hey gang,

On Friday, a great Brazilian comedy, "O Auto da Compadecida," will be shown in Somerville and it will include English subtitles. It's a tale that's based in the rural Northeast.

It is a funny, clever, lively, charming, and refreshing film in a pool of films from Brazil which more frequently sensationalize the crime and violence...And, it's the largest ever grossing Brazilian film.

The filming was done in the state of Paraiba and the soundtrack was done by the group Sa Grama from Recife (where Tamar, Bret, and I lived), Pernambuco.

The music genre comes from the Armorial Movement which is "an artistic initiative which aims to create an erudite art based on popular cultural elements of the Brazilian Northeast."
http://pt.wikipedia.o...

I remember when I saw the creators of the film receive an award in the Pernambuco State House and then there was an Armorial musical presentation. It was very good.

Announcement of the film showing: http://eastsomerville...
Information on the Armorial Movement (in Portuguese): http://pt.wikipedia.o...
Trailer (need to watch in Internet Explorer, apparently)
Some reviews on IMDB (8.1 out of 10 starts w/ 883 people voting).
Page on Wikipedia about the author, Ariano Suassuna, of the original story (in Portuguese).
Samples from the soundtrack.
Background and photo of Sa Grama. (in Portuguese)

If you only see one Brazilian film, it should be this one!

The film starts at 8pm so let's try to meet up around 7:30.

The show will be free!

Brasileiros, voces ja conhecem esse filme!
